Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 22 Apr 2019I dont think its dirty or cheating. It's all part of business.Even in reality, if you get an investor in your business, it doesn't mean things will work out. Some fail, some succeed. And they learn from their failure. Sometimes the market doesn't see the need for a certain product or service, sometimes a product is just a hype hence the shark tank business fails.There are even cases the investor and the owner are not able to agree on certain things so they fall out and the owner loses the investor. The shark tank investor most of the time gets a stake in the business but not enough to be a controlling shareholder. They provide advice and connections but if the owner does not listen or act on it, things can still go wrong.0 comments0
